meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a dome.
meanings.sent1: The building had a domal roof that curved gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The church's domal structure stood out in the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot under the domal lampshade.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the domal room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in vibrant domal hues.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the highest point of a dome.
meanings.sent1: The climber reached the domal peak of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The spire on top of the cathedral was the domal feature.
meanings.sent3: The chef proudly placed the cherry on the domal cake.
meanings.sent4: His voice reached a domal pitch as he sang the high notes.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered at the domal point of the mast.

meanings.sent1: The turtle's shell was smooth and domal in appearance.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a domal fountain at its center.
meanings.sent3: The balloon floated gracefully in the domal sky.
meanings.sent4: Her hat sat perched on her head like a domal crown.
meanings.sent5: The snow globe contained a tiny domal scene inside.
